title: How to get my novel edited for free - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A Hannah, Editing is a critical part of turning a written piece of work into a marketable product. You can pay a professional editor to do the work or you can follow a number of alternative paths to the (hopefully) same result. Many beginning writers just don’t have the cash to pay hundred of dollars to get their book edited, so that option is not realistic. So, the alternatives… BETA Group. This is a group of peers who read your work and give constructive feedback. Pick them from your writer’s group or approach friends and family who are relatively well read. It’s a sort of many eyes can find things that a single set might miss. Often writers will form a group of 5–6 who will do this for each other throughout the writing process, meeting weekly over coffee or whisky to talk read and reflect.Quid pro Quo. Find another writer who is at a similar level of skill and offer to edit their work in exchange for their editing yours.Mentor. Find an editor or professional writer who is willing to teach. The process of editing becomes the platform for the instruction.Delay method. You become your own editor. Put some time, at least six months, between the completion of your first draft and the revision process. The time will enable you to view the work with a bit more clarity. Work on something else during the interim.The kindly elder. Depending largely on your age, there may be any number of people who will gladly help you by editing your book. These might be teachers, grandparents, aunts or uncles or other people you know who will do it for you because they just love helping out emerging artists.Publisher. Most publishers take on new authors in what they recognize as pretty raw. Your agent will see the potential in your work, but will recognize when it needs to be honed for the market. Publishing houses have editors who know the ins and out of the market and can help you polish and focus your work. Proceeds from your book pay the salary of the whole publication team from editor to layout artist. The more work they have to do will of course cut into the royalties they pay you, but if it makes the book sell, why not?

“How can I get my novel edited for free?” Like this: Write a brilliant novel. Edit it yourself to the best of your abilities. Get a lot of beta readers. Get beta readers who are experienced editors who read your book for entertainment. As occupational obsessive compulsive behaviour kicks in and they offer their expertise to improve your writing, thank them for their help. Of course, this doesn’t work if you write rubbish. Editors don’t read rubbish for fun, they get paid to read rubbish, so why should they edit your rubbish for free. I know there are people who say I’m lucky to have editors among my enthusiastic beta readers, but it’s not luck. I had been writing for two decades before I thought about publishing my work. Two decades of honing my skills. Trading critique with other writers — reading their work and providing feedback, while they do the same for you — and being fearless about showing your drafts so you can improve yourself through constructive criticism. Nobody is waiting for your novel. You can edit it yourself, you can hunt around for beta readers, but if you want a professional editor to take a look, you will need to invest either time or money. No freebies.

You basically answered your own question. You need a professional editor who works on a freelance basis. EDIT: Due to a question merger, my answer is a little out of place as what I describe is certainly not free. The original question I answered to was: “How can I get my novel edited?” You may have writer friends who may offer to help - that may work, but being a good writer doesn’t necessarily make one a good editor. The problem is to find someone who is not only good but who also works well with you - a question of chemistry. There is a reason why writers and editors are often long-term collaborators (some of them are even married - figuratively as well as occasionally literally). You can find professional editors through a web search, on sites for freelancing gigs. Sometimes, editors are listed in the imprint of a book. In my experience though, the best way to find one is asking other writers for a referral. Also check for other projects your candidate has worked on - not just in terms of quality but also in terms of genre. Good professional editors will offer a small sample either for free or for little money. They may be picky about their projects, though. One word of warning: There are a lot of good editors out there, but also very bad ones and scammers as well. Personally, I would avoid working with a text services agency (they often underbid and oversell and treat their staff like s**t). In any case, ask for a direct contact to the editor working on your text. Good luck.

Not only can you get your novel edited for free, you can get someone to pay you for editing your novel: Sell the publication rights to a publishing house. They will edit your novel, advertise your novel, print your novel, and distribute your novel, and give you money in the process. Edited to add: The above might seem flip, but there’s a reality to it. Editing is work, and someone needs to pay for that work. It’s the publisher’s job to do that, not the author. There are a lot of scams out there, of services which will offer to publish your work for a fee, will give you lists of editors to hire, artists to do cover illustrations you can pay, etc. These are not how publishing traditionally work, and should be avoided. An old adage is “Money flows towards the author”. Avoid any arrangement that tries to change that around. If you want to self-publish, fine, but remember that the job of a publisher is different than the job of an author, and money will flow away from you-as-publisher, even if it always flows towards you-as-author.

The obvious answer is that you pay someone to do it. There are a million professional freelance editors out there and any of them will edit your manuscript for you if you pay them. The question is, what are you going to pay them to do? Fix your spelling and grammar? tighten up your writing? re-write it? They can do it, but it’ll cost you. Count on spending a couple thousand clams. My point here is that if you want to consider yourself a writer, you’ll have to learn to edit it and fix it yourself. Actually, reading your question again, I’d say, we can assume you can already do these things. In which case you need an editor to read it and tell you where the problems are, where it lags and where it needs to be reshuffled. That kind of editor is around and available. Expect to shell out one or two thousand bucks, depending on what you want them to do and not do. On this, you need to come to a very firm understanding of what the work will and will not entail. This is a very important point. Expect to pay something going in and you should agree to progress payments along the way.

You can edit it yourself. There are books and websites out there to guide you. This can help you improve your writing skills as you improve the manuscript. You’ll never be truly objective about your own work, though. You can get help from a beta reader. Beta readers are usually other writers who are willing to give you feedback on your manuscript. Their editing skills vary, and it’s not reasonable to expect a full line edit from a beta reader. If you sell a book to a publisher, the editor there will edit your book. Many literary agents also provide some editing help before subbing the book to publishers. If you’re self-publishing, this obviously isn’t an option. If you follow editors, agents and authors online, you may see giveaways for manuscript critiques, but these are usually only partial critiques. Editing an entire manuscript takes a tremendous amount of skill and time, so professionals don’t generally do it for free.

How can you get a plumber to fix your faucet for free? How can you get an electrician to wire your house for free? How can you get a doctor to treat you for free? The answer is, you can’t. Editing is difficult work. Why would you ask any professional to do it for free? Of course, you can get free help, but….you get what you pay for.

Try Upwork for a freelance editor. Post a job, stating word length and genre and be specific about what kind of editor you are looking for. As Helmut says, not everyone who can write can edit but somehow every writer thinks they are an editor too. A good editor can really pull your book together and transform it but you have to find someone who is a good fit for you.

You get what you pay for. Even good editors are not so good. A mediocre editing job is exactly the same as a bad one. For a job worthy of publication, you need a very good editor, and that is expensive. The only way I know to get a very good editor to edit your book for free is to get a literary agent and sell the book to a traditional publishing house. Don’t be daunted. Almost one of every thirty-five thousand submissions gets accepted.

Edit swap. Person A edits Person B’s novel. In return, Person B edits Person A’s novel. Be good enough to get someone you hold in high regard to be willing to do this. Not really “free”, but then, as Mercedes pointed out, what is?

Hire an editor.If you get a publishing contract, they will provide editing services as part of that publishing deal (if they charge you for editing and then publish you - then you are with the wrong kind of publisher).

I know this post is older, but no matter, I would recommend a freelance editor who has less experience than others, but is still good. I am saying this with bias as I am talking about myself. Freelance editors who are eager for new clients are going to do a tremendous job in order to add to their portfolio. I have a portfolio and would love to add to it. You can search for your local editors' association, like www.editors.ca, and find an editor with experience in editing your type of manuscript. Get quotes and references from several of them. Talk to a couple of editors about your goals and what they think of your manuscript.  You can also find a local writers' group and get feedback from members on what they think. They can provide some editorial direction.
Have a very good friend/family member who loves you very much and is also a crackerjack editor. Otherwise, you don’t. Professional editing is expensive.
